refsect1.title: Proposal
refsect1.para: The .toString() methods of the core classes give information about the content of the class. My proposal is that the resulting String of these methods is a String without \n and \r chars (thus a one-liner) that gives an overview of the class. Being a one-liner, the output can be used in Log4J debugging output, without having the problem that lines in the output become multilined.
Note that I assume that the toString() method is not to be used for formating the atom's properties, but just for quick developers access to its contents.

refsect1.title: Reason
refsect1.para:
At this moment the Log4J output is complicated by multilined debug lines like:
2002-11-26 15:11:58,883 [main] DEBUG org.openscience.cdk.applications.Viewer - 0. Atom Hg Hydrogen count: 0 Stereo Parity: 0 2D coordinates: (0.0021, -0.0041) 3D coordinates: (0.0021, -0.0041, 0.0020) Partial charge: 0.0 Formal charge: 0
A simple "grep -v applications.Viewer" now no longer removes all output from the applications.Viewer class. If the atom.toString() output would be one-lined, filtering could be done much easier.
